profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-10 19:05:31 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: Students Against Transphobia is a student group formed in response to transphobic comments made by Keith Ablow, then an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the Tufts School of Medicine. The collection documents the response to this incident.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged in one series.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Donated by Mark Tyson, Class of 2014, in May 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to the ad hoc student group, Students Against Transphobia, which formed in 2011 in response to transphobic comments made by Keith Ablow, then an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the School of Medicine. Materials include articles, op-eds, statements from President Monaco, and fliers; handmade "I am a Student Against Transphobia" buttons; and a handmade trans pride flag signed by students.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In the fall of 2011, Keith Ablow made statements on televised media that children could be harmed by watching transgender celebrity Chaz Bono on the show "Dancing with the Stars." At the time, Ablow was an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the Tufts School of Medicine, a voluntary and unpaid appointment. A group of students at Tufts formed the group Students Against Transphobia in protest of these statements.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Vanessa Formato, Archives and Research Assistant, in January 2020. The flag was photographed and stored in an oversize box with archival tissue to prevent color transfer and creasing. Buttons and textual materials, in an archival folder, were placed in the same archival box. Finding aid was updated at the time of processing.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Students Against Transphobia Records, 2011 -- 2012. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to the ad hoc student group, Students Against Transphobia, which formed in 2011 in response to transphobic comments made by Keith Ablow, then an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the Tufts University School of Medicine. Materials include articles, op-eds, statements from President Monaco, and fliers; handmade "I am a Student Against Transphobia" buttons; and a handmade trans pride flag signed by students.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a copy of a flier, a petition for Keith Ablow to be stripped of his title at the Tufts University School of Medicine, articles covering and reacting to Ablow's statements, and letters from President Monaco to the Tufts community and Mass. Transgender Political Coalition.
